titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale and New Haven Greeting Card Collection
Yale and New Haven Greeting Card Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:03

did.unittitle: Yale and New Haven greeting card collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of greeting cards, largely printed for the Christmas holiday season, depicting Yale buildings and grounds, New Haven scenes, and collections from the Yale University Library and Yale Art Gallery.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 48-A (YRG 48-A), Yale pictorial records and collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale and New Haven Greeting Card Collection (RU 688). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of greeting cards, largely printed for the Christmas holiday season, depicting Yale buildings and grounds, New Haven scenes, and collections from the Yale University Library and Yale Art Gallery.

did.unittitle: Old Brick Row with State House
Angelus Dni decendes de celo dicat Josph-Speculum humanae salvatonis
Commemorative relief from Sterling Memorial Library
Household emblems of Mary and Joseph-Wierix
One must feel how the birds fly-Shahn
The Virgin and Child with a pear-Beham
